author: hqucms
body:
#### PR description:

This PR implements the **ParticleNet** boosted jet tagger into CMSSW. The ParticleNet tagger uses a [novel graph neural network architecture](https://arxiv.org/abs/1902.08570) and shows significant performance improvement compared to the DeepAK8 algorithm. Two versions are provided: the nominal version (`pfParticleNetJetTags`) is a multi-class tagger for Top, W, Z, Higgs and their various decay modes, with very strong performance but features strong mass sculpting. The mass-decorrelated version (`pfMassDecorrelatedParticleNetJetTags`) is a generic two-prong tagger for X->bb, X->cc, and X->qq. It is trained w/ a special signal sample generated with a flat mass spectrum for the signal
particle (X) and shows substantial improvement in both discrimination power and mass decorrelation compared to the mass-decorrelated DeepAK8 tagger. The performance of the ParticleNet tagger is summarized in the DP note ([DP-2020/002](https://cds.cern.ch/record/2707946/files/DP2020_002.pdf)) and presentations in the [JME](https://indico.cern.ch/event/867397/contributions/3663927/attachments/1960091/3257280/ParticleNet_JMAR_20191210_H_Qu.pdf) and the [BTV](https://indico.cern.ch/event/868673/contributions/3671036/attachments/1960696/3258484/ParticleNet_BTV_20191211_H_Qu.pdf) groups.

Needs https://github.com/cms-data/RecoBTag-Combined/pull/26.

The current implementation is based on MXNet. Conversion to ONNX is not successful due to the complexity of the graph neural network architecture. The inference w/ MXNet takes \~60ms per AK8 jet per tagger (nominal and mass-decorrelated), or \~50ms/evt in total on a ttbar sample -- once we solve https://github.com/cms-sw/cmsdist/issues/5528. 

#### PR validation:

Implementation of this PR has been verified with the training framework and shows consistent results.
title: MXNet-based implementation of the ParticleNet tagger
